HPopupMenu

HPopupMenu is a control unit that represents a menu typically used in isolation, rather than as part of an extensive menu hierarchy.  By default, it operates in radio mode - the last item selected by the user, and only that item, is marked in the menu.

Summary
HPopupMenu
HPopupMenu is a control unit that represents a menu typically used in isolation, rather than as part of an extensive menu hierarchy.
Instance variables
constructor
setOwner
Sets the owner object of this pop-up menu.
selectItem
Selects the given menu item in this pop-up menu.
selectItemAtIndex
Selects a menu item that is placed in the given index in this pop-up menu.
selectedIndexChanged
Informs the owner object of changes in the selection on the pop-up menu.
mouseUpOnMenuItem
This gets called whenever the mouseUp event occurs in a menu item added to this pop up menu.

Instance variables

type’[HPopupMenu]’
valueNumeric value currently set to this object.
labelThe string that is shown as the label of this object.
selectedIndexThe index of the currently selected menu item.  Negative number if nothing is selected.
selectedItemThe menu item that is currently selected.  A null value if nothing is selected.
ownerA reference to the object that is set as the owner of this menu.

Extends

HMenu

See also

HControl HMenu

constructor

constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)

Parameters

_rectAn HRect object that sets the position and dimensions of this control.
_parentClassThe parent view that this control is to be inserted in.
_options(optional) All other parameters.  See HComponentDefaults.

setOwner

setOwner: function(_owner)

Sets the owner object of this pop-up menu.  The owner receives notification from the menu when the selection changes on it.  Usually this should not be called by the user, as this is in most cases called by the owner component.

Parameters

_ownerThe object that owns this pop-up menu.

selectItem

selectItem: function(_item)

Selects the given menu item in this pop-up menu.

Parameters

_itemA reference to a HMenuItem object that should be selected.

selectItemAtIndex

selectItemAtIndex: function(_index)

Selects a menu item that is placed in the given index in this pop-up menu.

Parameters

_indexThe index of the menu item that should be selected.

selectedIndexChanged

selectedIndexChanged: function()

Informs the owner object of changes in the selection on the pop-up menu.  This method is called automatically by the HPopupMenu object.

mouseUpOnMenuItem

This gets called whenever the mouseUp event occurs in a menu item added to this pop up menu.

HMenu is a control unit that displays a pull-down or pop-up list of menu items.
Abstract foundation class for all active visual components that implement events and values.
A Rect object represents a rectangle.
Define default setting here.
A HMenuItem object displays one item within a menu and contains the state associated with that item.
